description.narrative:
Target area: Gaza Province (Chigubo District).
Target number of beneficiaries: 3,375 households (16,875 individuals) Goal: To mitigate the negative impacts of drought impacting the lives of children and families in Mozambique through Food Security and Livelihoods, WASH and Nutrition interventions. Impact: To ensure children and their parents/children and their parents/careers in Gaza Province are able to meet basic needs to enable a healthy and dignified life at all times without engaging in negative coping mechanisms. Outcome: Affected households have adequate access to food and water and nutritional support to meet their daily essential needs, as well as access to market integrated livelihood activities which support their children#s wellbeing.
Sector Objectives: WASH Sector -Affected communities have access to and use safe water and sanitation, and adopt improved hygiene practices, leading to reduced incidence of diarrhea and therefore risks of under/malnutrition. Output 1: Targeted households have sustained access to safe water in sufficient quantity (for their own consumption), and improved knowledge of hygiene and sanitation practices
FSL Sector - To enable crisis-affected households to cover their immediate needs and protect/restoretheirlivelihoods options without having to employ harmful coping strategies, especially those that pose an increased risk to women and children. Output 2: 3,375 vulnerable households in communities receive essential food baskets through market integratedsupport Output 3: 3,375 vulnerable households provided with livelihood inputs and support
Nutrition Sector - Establish / Provide screening and referral mechanisms to rapidly ensure treatment for severe and moderate acute malnutrition (SAM and MAM) andreduce the incidence of malnutrition in communities Output 4: More than 50% ofSAM and MAM cases from the target communities are identified and referred to the respective nutritional rehabilitation services Output 5: District health services have increasedcapacity to plan for emergency nutrition responses
Child Protection - Promote community awareness and engagement in the protection of marginalized populations including women and children. Output 6: Increased awareness and participation of fieldstaff and community on key child protection issues.
